title: Data set - ozone depletion and food chains

content.prompt: Which of the following is the most valid conclusion that can be inferred from this experiment?

choices.label: Natural UV levels are having a dramatic effect on productivity in the upper levels of the tropical oceans, where light intensity is high.
The thinning of the Antarctic ozone layer is likely to have a dramatic effect on the entire polar food chain.
Photosynthetic rates of polar phytoplankton under ambient conditions of light are very similar to those of phytoplankton in temperate areas.
UV radiation reaching the ocean surface near Antarctica has already increased about 500% over preindustrial levels.
UV radiation is a very important wavelength needed for photosynthesis in polar phytoplankton.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
